meanings.definition: Collide violently with an obstacle or another vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The car crashes into the wall.
meanings.sent2: She crashes her bike into a tree.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown crashes into the cake, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The waves crash against the rocks with great force.
meanings.sent5: The thunder crashes in the stormy sky, frightening the children.

meanings.definition: Sudden loud noise of something breaking or falling.
meanings.sent1: I heard a crash in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The crash of the glass startled everyone.
meanings.sent3: The crash of the cymbals signaled the end of the performance.
meanings.sent4: The crash of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The crash of the falling tree echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: Sudden and rapid decline in the value or price of something.
meanings.sent1: The stock market experienced a crash.
meanings.sent2: The housing market crash affected many families.
meanings.sent3: The sudden crash in the price of gold surprised investors.
meanings.sent4: The crash in the cryptocurrency market was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The crash in the economy led to layoffs and closures.

meanings.definition: Enter or cause to enter a state of malfunction.
meanings.sent1: The computer crashes when too many programs are open.
meanings.sent2: He crashes his phone by dropping it in water.
meanings.sent3: The robot crashes and starts dancing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The system crashes due to a power outage.
meanings.sent5: The engine crashes, leaving the car stranded on the highway.
